title: desouza420
author: desouza420
content: Hello guysIf you had a free 500w /h what crypto will you be mining?i will install some solar power on my room and i calculate that i will have about 500w /h free and i intent to use these watts for miningwhat would be the best option for me?i am a newbie when comes to miningis monero or z cash still profitable? would an antminer x3 500w will be a good option for me?thank you in advance

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Quote from: desouza420 on May 23, 2022, 09:03:08 PMHello guysIf you had a free 500w /h what crypto will you be mining?i will install some solar power on my room and i calculate that i will have about 500w /h free and i intent to use these watts for miningwhat would be the best option for me?i am a newbie when comes to miningis monero or z cash still profitable? would an antminer x3 500w will be a good option for me?thank you in advanceI think if you’re expecting solar power to run your miners you have a lot to learn. The amount of batteries you would need to keep it going through the night or cloudy days would be so much that it isn’t even worth mentioning that you plan to install solar. It’s nice to have solar to help with long term electricity costs, but it’s really more of a home choice than an addition to a home mining setup. Even if you spend nearly $50K on your solar setup like I did, it would still barely power a small mining setup.

comments.author: Takyeon
comments.body: If 500watt is what your solar panel can provide it will be stupid to use 500watt machine on it because 1. Sun isn't going to be stable, there will be fluctuations.2. You will need to recharge your backup batteries.A 500W solar setup is for a 250watt load max, if your mining machine is going to use 500watt go with a 1000watt solar setup..
